thread.title: Timberwolves launch new digital ticket system
thread.title_full: Timberwolves launch new digital ticket system

title: Timberwolves launch new digital ticket system
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Timberwolves launch new digital ticket system Monday night is also a "practice round" for the team's new digital paperless system, known as Flash Seats. Post to Facebook Timberwolves launch new digital ticket system Monday night is also a "practice round" for the team's new digital paperless system, known as Flash Seats.   kare11.com: http://www.kare11.com/story/sports/nba/timberwolves/2015/10/05/timberwolves-launches-new-digital-ticket-system/73413208/   1   Timberwolves launch new digital ticket system Timberwolves tickets going completely digital Lindsey Seavert, KARE 9:54 p.m. EDT October 5, 2015 Timberwolves launch new digital ticket system. (Photo: KARE) 63 CONNECT 7 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
MINNEAPOLIS â€“ An estimated 14,000 fans crowd Target Center for the popular Timberwolves free open scrimmage, but not one person will walk in with a traditional ticket. 
Monday night is a "practice round" for the team's new digital paperless system, known as Flash Seats . 
"We are the first team in the Twin Cities to launch this innovative digital ticketing system," said Ryan Tanke, Timberwolves Senior Vice President and Chief Revenue Officer. "Number one, it's super convenient, allows our fans and empowers them to manage their account anywhere, anytime. All they need is a mobile device or internet. Two, it's flexible so you have the ability to transfer tickets with a couple of thumb clicks." 
Tanke says with Flash Seats, fans will have three ways to enter the game; by downloading the Flash Seats app on a smart phone , by credit card or with a Minnesota driver's license. 
As a smart phone, credit card or driver's license is scanned, it will automatically print out a "seat locator," which looks more like a ticket for fans to enter the arena. The team will provide extra staffing at ticket entrances, knowing some fans may struggle to adapt to the new technology. 
Seats at Target Center (Photo: KARE) 
"There is a learning curve. We have been going through this process with the Minnesota Lynx. They actually were the first team to go through it this past summer. It's change , and as people go through change, it's education," Tanke said. 
But the Timberwolves say now the days of lost, stolen and fraudulent tickets will be eliminated, and with time, a swipe with the new ticketing system of the future will bring a slam dunk for fans. 
"It's convenient, flexible and secure," Tanke said. "Folks are loving it once they go through and see how convenient it Is for them." 
The Timberwolves say Flash Seats eliminates long lines at will call and makes transferring tickets easier. 
Box office at Target Center (Photo: KARE) 
Fans can still walk up to the box office and buy tickets with cash the day of games. Again, to help fans acclimate, extra help will be provided for people entering at the two preseason games before the Nov. 2 home opener. 
Flash Seats provides digital ticketing for entertainment venues and sports teams (NBA, NFL, NCAA) throughout the U.S., including the Cleveland Cavaliers, Houston Rockets and the NCAA Final Four, and was also successfully launched at Target Center for the 2015 Minnesota Lynx season, which tipped-off in May. 
Download Flash Seats on iTunes here. 63 CONNECT 7 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://www.kare11.com/story/sports/nba/timberwolves/2015/10/05/timberwolves-launches-new-digital-ticket-system/73413208/ TOP VIDEOS
